intro: Epilobium occidentale, commonly known as the western willow herb, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, disturbed habitats such as streambanks and meadows. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Epilobium occidentale is part of the Onagraceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits.
